means: 使预先有倾向( predispose的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Franklin was predisposed to believe him.
sentence.Network_cn: 富兰克林倾向于相信他。

sentence.Network_en: He believes that some people are predisposed to criminal behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为有些人容易犯罪。

sentence.Network_en: His early training predisposed him to a life of adventure.
sentence.Network_cn: 他早年所受的训练使他易于接受冒险生活.

易受污染损害... ... ) ulnerable to pollution 易受污染损害的 ) predispose to damage 易受损害的 ) pollution damage 污染损害.

entry.def: If something predisposes you to think or behave in a particular way, it makes it likely that you will think or behave in that way.

example.ex: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well...
example.tran: 他们千方百计雇用那些性格上天生适合服务顾客的人。

example.ex: There is evidence to suggest that certain factors predispose some individuals to criminal behaviour.
example.tran: 有证据表明，特定的因素会使某些人产生犯罪倾向。

entry.tran: 使易感染，使易患（某种疾病）
entry.def: If something predisposes you to a disease or illness, it makes it likely that you will suffer from that disease or illness.

example.ex: ...a gene that predisposes people to alcoholism.

sentences.sentence: "because of conditions in the mine, miners are predisposed to lung disease"

auth_sentence.content: The majority of his judges...came predisposed to condemn him.
auth_sentence.res_content: The majority of his judges...came predisposed to condemn him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The majority of his judges...came predisposed to condemn him.

auth_sentence.content: Humans are genetically predisposed to reproduce.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Humans are genetically predisposed to reproduce.

auth_sentence.content: Based on this introduction, the reader is predisposed to believe what follows.
auth_sentence.res_content: Based on this introduction, the reader is predisposed to believe what follows.
